article.title: Assessing the Stylistic Properties of Neurally Generated Text in Authorship Attribution

multiple_choice_question.text: What information does Figure 1 convey about the Patrologia Latina (PL) corpus?
choices: It shows the average length of documents for all authors in the corpus.
It ranks the 18 most prolific authors in the corpus by document count and visualizes their average document length.
It compares the lexical diversity of the 18 most prolific authors in the corpus.
It highlights the authors in the corpus with the most stylistically distinct writing.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the purpose of splitting the corpus into sets α and ω in Figure 2’s experimental setup?
choices: To compare the performance of different classifiers on the same dataset.
To train and test language models on two completely independent datasets.
To create a balanced experimental design for comparing the properties of generated and authentic text in authorship attribution.
To demonstrate the effect of data size on authorship attribution accuracy.

multiple_choice_question.text: What overall trend does Figure 3 illustrate regarding the F1 scores of authorship attribution?
choices: Classifiers trained on authentic data consistently outperform classifiers trained on generated data.
RNNLM-based generation always leads to lower authorship attribution scores compared to NGLM-based generation.
Augmenting training data with RNNLM-generated text generally improves authorship attribution accuracy, while NGLM-generated data shows mixed results.
There is no discernible difference in authorship attribution performance between models trained on authentic versus generated data.

multiple_choice_question.text: What key difference between NGLM and RNNLM-generated text does Figure 4 highlight?
choices: NGLM-generated text exhibits greater lexical diversity than RNNLM-generated text.
RNNLM-generated text clusters more closely with authentic text than NGLM-generated text.
NGLM-generated text more closely mirrors the ngram frequency distribution of authentic text compared to RNNLM-generated text.
Both NGLM and RNNLM-generated texts are clearly distinguishable from authentic text in terms of ngram frequency.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does Formula (5) represent in the context of RNN-based Language Modeling?
choices: The calculation of the hidden state activation within the recurrent layer of the network.
The probability distribution over the vocabulary for the next symbol in the sequence, conditioned on the preceding context.
The update rule for the learnable gates within a Long Short-Term Memory (LSTM) cell.
The calculation of the embedding vector for a given input symbol.
